Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou <FI>wast<Fi> not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; <FI>and<Fi> when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
And your spoil shall be gathered <FI>like<Fi> the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, <FI>and<Fi> strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> his treasure.<RF>salvation: Heb. salvations<Rf>
Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.<RF>valiant…: or, messengers<Rf>
The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

The earth mourneth <FI>and<Fi> languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed <FI>and<Fi> hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off <FI>their fruits<Fi>.<RF>hewn…: or, withered away<Rf>
Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, <FI>as<Fi> fire, shall devour you.
And the people shall be <FI>as<Fi> the burnings of lime: <FI>as<Fi> thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.<CM>
Hear, ye <FI>that are<Fi> far off, what I have done; and, ye <FI>that are<Fi> near, acknowledge my might.
The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;<RF>righteously: Heb. in righteousnesses<Rf><RF>uprightly: Heb. uprightnesses<Rf><RF>oppressions: or, deceits<Rf><RF>blood: Heb. bloods<Rf>
He shall dwell on high: his place of defence <FI>shall be<Fi> the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters <FI>shall be<Fi> sure.<RF>high: Heb. heights, or, high places<Rf>
Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.<RF>that…: Heb. of far distances<Rf>
Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where <FI>is<Fi> the scribe? where <FI>is<Fi> the receiver? where <FI>is<Fi> he that counted the towers?<RF>receiver: Heb. weigher?<Rf>
Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, <FI>that thou canst<Fi> not understand.<RF>stammering: or, ridiculous<Rf>

Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle <FI>that<Fi> shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

But there the glorious LORD <FI>will be<Fi> unto us a place of broad rivers <FI>and<Fi> streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.<RF>of…: Heb. broad of spaces, or, hands<Rf>
For the LORD <FI>is<Fi> our judge, the LORD <FI>is<Fi> our lawgiver, the LORD <FI>is<Fi> our king; he will save us.<RF>lawgiver: Heb. statutemaker<Rf>

Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.<RF>Thy…: or, They have forsaken thy tacklings<Rf>
And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein <FI>shall be<Fi> forgiven <FI>their<Fi> iniquity.<CM>
